member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects
member.summary: The data structure that is used to pass information between Avatar and the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
The OptionObjects class contains the logic for managing OptionObjects, which contain
all of the content and metadata of the Avatar form that is sent to the Tingen Web
Service.

ERROR CODES
When an OptionObject is returned to Avatar, it requires one of the following
"Error Code" (which is an integer value):
Error Code Description
0 No action taken
1 Returns an Error Message with an "Ok" button, and stops further processing of scripts
2 Returns an Error Message with "OK" and "Cancel" buttons, and stops further scripts the user clicks "Cancel")
3 Returns an Error Message with "Ok" button
4 Returns an Error Message with "Yes" and "No" buttons and stops further scripts the user clicks "No")
5 Returns a URL to be opened in a new browser
6 Returns a form to be opened in Avatar

The most common Error Codes are:
1 Used when you don't want the user to take an action, such as submitting a form
3 Used when you would like to notify the user of something
4 Used when you want warn the user they may want to make changes, and give them the option to stop further processing, or continuing

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.SentOptObj
member.summary: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.WorkOptObj

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ReturnOptObj

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ExeAsm
member.summary: The executing Assembly name.
member.remarks: A required component for writing log files, defined here so it can be used throughout the class.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.ConvertErrorString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a human-readable error string to the corresponding OptionObject error value.

remarks.para:
In order to make assigning an Error Code a little easier when developing the
Tingen Web Service, there is the option of using an "error string" instead of
the integer value (which will be converted to the appropriate integer value):
Error string Error Code
"clone" or "none or "success" 0
"error" 1
"okcancel" 2
"info" 3
"yesno" 4
"openurl" 5
"openform" 6
Please see the class documentation for more information about
Error Codes.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.OptionObjects.Finalize(Outpost31.Core.Session.TngnWbsvSession,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Finalize an OptionObject so it can be returned to Avatar.
member.param: The Tingen Session data structure object.

remarks.para: Before an OptionObject can be returned to Avatar, we need to make sure that all of the required components exist and/or are modified correctly.
Please see the class documentation for more information about Error Codes.

member.summary: Runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para: This class is used to set the runtime configurations for the Tingen Web Service.

member.summary: The Tingen Web Service version number.

member.summary: The environment that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.

member.summary: The Tingen Web Service mode.

member.summary: The Tingen Web Service data path.

member.summary: The name of the machine running the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.TngnWbsvRuntimeSettings.CurrentDate
member.summary: The current date in YYMMDD format.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.TngnWbsvRuntimeSettings.CurrentTime
member.summary: The current time in HHMMSS format.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Runtime.TngnWbsvRuntimeSettings.New(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RuntimeSettings class.
member.returns: An object containing the runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para: This method sets all runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service.

The following runtime settings are loaded from external files:
tngnWbsvEnv
The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.
This value is stored in the .\AppData\Runtime\TngnWbsv.Env file,
and must be a valid Avatar environment.
If this file does not exist, the Tingen Web Service will not start.
tngnWbsvEnvDataPath
The path on the machine that hosts the Tingen Web Service, where all data
required by the Tingen Web Service will be stored. This is per-environment,
and the first part of this path is hardcoded as C:\Tingen_Data\, so
the directory must exist on the hosts machine.
tngnWbsvMode
The Avatar environment that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.
This value is stored in the .\AppData\Runtime\TngnWbsv.Env file,
and must be a valid Avatar environment.
If this file does not exist, the Tingen Web Service will not start.

In addition to the above, this method also sets the Tingen Web Service build number,
which is in YYMMDD format. This value must be updated whenever the Tingen Web Service
is deployed to the host machine.

member.summary: Session logic for the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
The TngnWbsvSession class is used to create and initialize a TngnWbsvSession object, which
contains all of the information the Tingen Web Service needs to process a request.

member.remarks: The TngnWbsvConfig object contains all runtime and external configuration information.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Session.TngnWbsvSession.New(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new TngnWbsvSession object
member.param: The OptionObject that is sent from Avatar.
The Script Parameter that is sent from Avatar.
The current version of the Tingen Web Service.
member.returns: A new Tingen Web Service session object.

remarks.para:
The TngnWbsvSession object contains:
The TngnWbsvConfig object All runtime and external configuration information
OptionObjects All necessary OptionObjects
The Scriptlink Script Parameter The Script Parameter sent from Avatar that contains the request
An Avatar System Code The Avatar System Code that the Tingen Web Service will interface with

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile
member.summary: Logic related to files input/output.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile.ReadLocal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the contents or status of a file.

remarks.para:
If the file exists and has content, that content is returned.
If the file does not exist, or exists but is empty, an error message is returned.

member.returns: The content or status of the file.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Utility.Du.DuFile.ReadAndVerifyLocal(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the contents (if valid) or status of a file.

remarks.para:
GetContent() returns the contents or status of the file.
If the file contains data, that data is checked against the list of valid content.

member.returns: The verified content or status of the file.
